title: Enhancing Mathematical Thinking and Creating Economic Outcomes Using Digital Learning Technologies: Strengthening Modeling and Proof Skills Based on Equations, Statistics, and Graphs

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematical knowledge (algebra, geometry, statistics) and workplace data analysis experience, foundational formula calculation, and graph interpretation skills
context.additional_context: An adaptive learning technology-based customized mathematics curriculum using digital platforms in smartphone-centric, limited technological environments: emphasizes real-life problem-solving through computational skills, formula application, and graph interpretation. Particularly focuses on cultivating data-driven decision-making abilities in economic/business contexts.

learning_goals: Through project-based learning, learners will improve their abilities in solving linear/nonlinear equations and statistical modeling by over 30% and expand logical thinking via mathematical proofs.

Using adaptive learning technology, learners will strengthen personalized feedback systems based on individual progress and enhance probabilistic/statistical problem-solving skills, particularly deepening multivariate data analysis and graph interpretation abilities.
Learners will evaluate and improve job-related data interpretation skills (graph analysis, trend prediction, statistical significance testing) by analyzing digital learning platforms.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
